Initial proposal: Parties shall bargain in good faith to replace invalid provision; new language incorporated into agreement
Changed: Weakened to 'agree to discuss' instead of 'bargain in good faith'; added no obligation to reopen/bargain unless both parties agree (was: shall bargain in good faith)

Final: Parties agree to discuss and renegotiate affected provisions within 30 days following written request; renegotiation may be delayed/paused by mutual agreement (Union's stronger obligation language prevailed over University's optional discussion)
Initial proposal: No GSW penalized for non-completion of work due to lack of access to spaces and systems where work needs are met
Initial proposal: Formal medical documentation not required for flexible timelines/locations for specific conditions
Initial proposal: Access requests receive decision within 2 business days if approved immediately, 5 business days if not; if cannot meet request, explanation and alternative provided
Initial proposal: By start of contract, implement centralized processes for changing offices and classrooms to meet GSWs' physical, sensory and/or other health needs
Initial proposal: Provide and bear cost for ASL interpreters and CART services at any event upon request or where reasonable to expect D/deaf or Hard-of-Hearing person might attend
Initial proposal: Provide and bear cost for universal, modern text-to-speech and speech-to-text software usable on any device, including updates and new releases

Initial proposal: Complete annual accessibility audit on all campuses within one calendar year; committee with Union and University representatives (up to 3 each) reviews and makes recommendations; University takes reasonable steps to implement within one month
Initial proposal: University provides GSWs receiving accommodations with names, contact info, schedules of service providers at least 24 hours ahead of usage; includes third-party providers

Initial proposal: Maintain at least 1 FTE staff for disability accommodations; full-time staff for implementing accessibility-related responsibilities; trained staff in disability lens and asset-based models
Initial proposal: Appointment letters provided at least 90 calendar days before appointment start date
Changed: Different timelines - 45 calendar days for Instructors of Record, 30 calendar days for all else (was: 90 days for all)
Initial proposal: GSWs working 20+ hours/week must be salaried with minimum term of one academic year (Fall, Spring, Summer)
Changed: Reduced minimum term to one academic term (fall, spring, summer 1, or summer 2) instead of full academic year (was: one academic year)
Initial proposal: All information must be included in appointment letter; undetermined items conveyed within 10 calendar days
Changed: Added 'if known at time of letter' for supervisor and work schedule; specific deadline of 10 business days before start for items C and E (was: all items required, 10 days for undetermined)
Initial proposal: Statement that GSW will not be expected to provide clerical services or tasks outside appointment classification
Changed: Removed requirement for clerical services statement in appointment letter (was: required statement)
Initial proposal: No GSW shall be denied right to work within bargaining unit outside their program department
Changed: Added qualifier 'as permissible by law' to cross-department work rights (was: absolute right)
Changed: Changed statement from 'subject to' a CBA to 'covered by' a CBA, added link to agreement (was: subject to)
Initial proposal: GSWs beyond guaranteed funding notified at least 90 calendar days before appointment start (no general timing specified for others)
Changed: University makes reasonable efforts for 30 days before start; IoR receives assignments 45 days before fall/spring (was: 90 days for beyond-funding GSWs only)
No change: Maintained 30 days general
Changed: Increased to 45 days general, 60 days for IoR (was: University proposed 30/45)
Changed: Reduced back to 30 days general, 45 days for IoR (was: 45/60)
Initial proposal: GSWs beyond guaranteed funding years notified at least 90 days before semester start; admission letters include total years of guaranteed funding
Changed: Removed all guaranteed funding provisions (was: 90 days notice, tracking of guaranteed years)

Changed: Reduced notice to 45 days for beyond-funding GSWs (was: 90 days)
Initial proposal: Not specified in Appointments article (referenced Appointment Security article for detailed requirements)

Changed: Added 3 new requirements - course assignment for TAs, link to union contract, FERPA waiver information (was: 6 basic items)

Changed: Removed all requirements for written departmental procedures (was: detailed procedure requirements)
Changed: Re-proposed written procedures with 7 coverage areas and GSW feedback mechanisms (was: University removed entirely)
Changed: Simplified GSW input to 'mechanism for soliciting advice such as committee or draft comments' (was: extensive draft review and collective meetings)

Initial proposal: Departments must clarify in writing criteria addressing eligibility, ranking, evaluative factors, experience weighting, equitable distribution; decisions not arbitrary/capricious/punitive/discriminatory
Changed: Removed all appointment criteria requirements (was: detailed transparency requirements)
Changed: Re-proposed appointment criteria requirements with 4 areas to address (was: University removed entirely)
Initial proposal: All stipended appointments for at least 1 academic term; University makes reasonable efforts for longer terms when possible

New: Added requirement to include link to union contract in appointment letters
New: Added requirement to include information about submitting FERPA waiver for release of information to union

Initial proposal: Length set in posting; subject to availability and funding; subject to change or cancellation; no guarantee of additional assignments; maintains work study rules and payment processes
Initial proposal: Comprehensive 5-part definition including machine learning, neural networks, cognitive systems, automated decision-making; excludes simple automation and rule-based systems
Initial proposal: University cannot use AI to replace any position governed by agreement or traditionally filled by GSW, directly or indirectly
Initial proposal: AI cannot be used in hiring, position distribution, salaries, discipline, dismissals, or other employment decisions due to risks of discrimination
Initial proposal: AI cannot monitor GSW performance, location, device usage, or productivity; no AI monitoring software required on GSW devices (personal or University-maintained)

Initial proposal: 3-month notice before AI implementation; must provide testing and performance data including accuracy, bias metrics, training data; Union approval required before implementation; Union included in oversight bodies
Initial proposal: Appointed contact for AI accountability; semester reports on model performance; annual inventory and audits of all AI systems; initial inventory within 6 months of agreement
Initial proposal: Pool of neutral experts; extended grievance timeline; expert access to AI system within 14 days; expert review within 21 days; expert testimony at each grievance step
Initial proposal: All GSW data (before, during, or after employment) prohibited from use in AI systems without explicit consent, regardless of purpose or anonymity
Initial proposal: Defines Employment-Based and Independently Created Digital Replicas; University cannot use digital replica of GSW without consent and separate bargaining for that use
Initial proposal: Cannot digitally alter audio, video, or recordings of GSWs created during employment without consent and bargaining; must include description of intended alterations
Initial proposal: Automation defined as replacement of human functions and duties by machines
column8: or any technology that diminishes need for human labor (in part or fully)

column5: Initial proposal: Employer cannot automate any position governed by agreement or traditionally filled by GSW, directly or indirectly; cannot use automation to temporarily replace struck work
Changed: Added protection - if position automated or GSW hours reduced through automation, GSW will be given additional work to make up lost hours (was: prohibition only, no make-up work provision)
Initial proposal: Cannot automate monitoring of GSW employment duties, performance, location, device usage, or productivity; no monitoring software on GSW devices (personal or University-maintained)

Changed: Added exception - automated location monitoring permitted for security, emergency response, disability accommodation, and access control, provided info not used to violate prohibition (was: absolute prohibition)
Initial proposal: Cannot use digital replica of GSW without consent and separate bargaining; consent must be clear, conspicuous, include specific description, obtained in writing prior to use
Changed: Digital Replica definition now explicitly references Article XX: Artificial Intelligence (was: implicit definition within Automation article)
Initial proposal: University shall not discipline or dismiss GSW without just cause

Changed: Academic matters (standing, progress, performance, quality, dishonesty) at University sole discretion, not grievable; discipline only for non-academic misconduct with just cause; progressive discipline not always warranted (was: just cause for all discipline/dismissal)
Initial proposal: Discipline includes written warnings, unpaid suspensions, or dismissal/discharge based on job-related misconduct
Changed: Added - paid administrative leave permitted without prior notice to investigate misconduct (was: only unpaid suspensions, no administrative leave provision)
Initial proposal: Department/supervisor shall make every effort to address concerns before disciplinary action; no decision at this stage precedential
Changed: Weakened to 'supervisors will, as best practice, attempt to address concerns' (was: shall make every effort)
Changed: Restored 'shall make every effort' language (was: University's weakened 'best practice' language)

Initial proposal: Written notice to GSW and Union including reasons, nature of violation with policy cited/attached, potential discipline level, right to investigatory meeting, right to Union representation

Changed: Limited to discharge cases only; notice includes conduct at issue, that discharge being considered, right to representative (was: all discipline investigations with more detailed requirements)
Initial proposal: GSW told specific charges, evidence, reports; Union rep can represent and speak for GSW; opportunity to respond and propose mitigation options; Weingarten rights preserved
Changed: Only for discharge; Union rep or another bargaining unit member; availability cannot delay meeting (was: all investigations, Union rep only, comprehensive process)
Changed: Restored Union representative right (struck through 'or another bargaining unit member'); specified rep can 'advise' GSW (was: University option for non-Union rep)
Initial proposal: GSW told final outcome, evidence, reports, explanation for action; right to Union rep who can represent and speak
Changed: Removed disciplinary hearing requirement entirely (was: required hearing with representation rights)
Changed: Restored disciplinary hearing requirement with Union representation (was: University removed entirely)
Initial proposal: Union may appeal dismissal to expedited arbitration; University maintains GSW in pay status until decision rendered
Changed: Union files grievance at Step 2 within 20 days; removed pay status maintenance (was: expedited arbitration, pay status maintained)
Changed: Combined approaches - Step 2 grievance within 20 days AND restored pay status maintenance until decision (was: University removed pay status)
Initial proposal: University maintains confidentiality to GSW and Union; documents filed separately from personnel and academic records
Changed: Confidentiality consistent with FERPA; Union agrees to cooperate with FERPA compliance procedures (was: absolute confidentiality with separate filing)

Changed: For stipended - appointment letter plus discipline unrelated to academics; for hourly - info from SEGAF including dates, pay, hours, supervisor; explicitly excludes FERPA-covered and academic records (was: broader inclusion)
Changed: Added written performance evaluations unrelated to academics; explicitly excludes grievances and related documents (was: just appointment letter and discipline)

Changed: Specified different fields for stipended vs hourly; hourly includes anticipated end date if reflected (was: same fields for all)
Changed: Added 'frequency of pay' for hourly assignments (was: just pay rate)
Initial proposal: GSWs can review employment records at any time in Workday; new additions/changes within 2 business days

Changed: Can obtain copy once per academic term by request to associate dean/SEGAF; 10 business day response time; will transition to direct systems access by year 2 of agreement (was: any time access in Workday, 2-day updates)

Changed: Finalized at 6 months of agreement start for online direct systems access (was: negotiating timeline)

Changed: Removed all Union representative access provisions (was: GSW could authorize Union access)

Changed: Access through FERPA release identified in separate article; otherwise same terms (was: Union's direct authorization)

Changed: Back to University 'may' consider, 'may' adjust (was: Union 'shall' consider)
Changed: University 'shall consider' email, 'may adjust' (was: may consider, may adjust)

No change: Maintained Far UV lighting feasibility study

Initial proposal: University shall directly pay in advance for lodging, transportation, and conference registration fees; per diem for food at U.S. GSA domestic and State Department international rates; 14 days notice required via digital travel advance request form through departmental website or NU-RES; prepaid expenses covered through departmental/advisor NUCard and Concur system

Initial proposal: Emergency medical travel expenses covered or reimbursed by University when certification from qualified healthcare provider or doctor presented; emergency medical travel defined as treatment requiring immediate attention not available on site; access to emergency services or reimbursement does not require University pre-approval

Initial proposal: As condition of employment, GSWs covered under Agreement shall within 30 days of employment or 30 days of effective date of Agreement either sign Union membership card and pay initiation fees and dues as determined by Union, or if choosing not to be member, pay to Union agency fee equivalent to dues; agency fee amount determined by Union but no more than dues charged for membership; Union provides University with formula for calculating dues and agency fees

Initial proposal: Upon ratification of Agreement, University and Union shall jointly notify all GSWs of obligation to either join Union or pay agency fee; notice includes application for Union membership card and dues deduction authorization card; notice provided both electronically and in hard copy

Initial proposal: University notifies each GSW at time of hire of obligation to pay dues or fair share agency fees as provided in Section 2; University notifies Union of each new hire within a week of hire

Initial proposal: Upon notification from Union that GSW provided authorization, University deducts Union membership dues and fees or fair share agency fees from each paycheck; University remits dues and fees to Union as defined in Section 6 with electronic list of names of GSWs from whom deductions made; list contains employee's name, NU ID number, email address, department, amount of dues/fees deducted, and gross wages
Initial proposal: Deductions commence upon notification of GSW's authorization and continue unless affirmatively revoked
Initial proposal: University electronically transmits to Union on first working day after each payday all dues and fair share agency fees deducted for that pay period in accordance with Section 4

Initial proposal: Union agrees to indemnify and hold University harmless from any claims, actions, or proceedings by any person or entity arising from any deductions under Union direction made under this Article

Initial proposal: Failure by GSW to pay required dues or fees constitutes cause for termination of GSW's employment; prior to time Union notifies University in writing that employment should be terminated for failure to comply, Employer provides GSW 30 days written notice of non-compliance

Initial proposal: University furnishes GSWs with 'Authorization and Checkoff of Contributions to UAW V-CAP' digital form as part of standard process for enrolling GSW into University's payroll system in accordance with Article on Voluntary Community Action Program (VCAP)

Changed: Graduate students are free to decide whether or not to join Union and pay membership dues or fees, or to discontinue paying membership dues or fees; University shall not coerce or attempt to influence graduate student about decision to join or not join Union, or whether to pay or not pay membership dues/fees (was: membership or agency fee required as condition of employment within 30 days)

Changed: There shall be no consequences for bargaining unit members who fail to pay fees after choosing to pay dues/fees; payment of union dues or fees not a condition of student's continued appointment as SGA or in hourly position (was: failure to pay constitutes cause for termination after 30-day notice)

Changed: Any bargaining unit member who does not voluntarily become and remain member in good standing of Union and instead chooses to pay agency fee shall be charged fee determined by Union in accordance with applicable law as percentage of full dues uniformly required to be paid and initiation fees by those who choose to become members (was: agency fee equivalent to dues, no more than dues charged for membership, as alternative to mandatory membership)

Changed: Union reports to University missing or incorrect deductions for dues or agency fees as they become known; in event of payroll deduction for unit member in manner inconsistent with member's signed authorization form or terms of Agreement, University corrects error as soon as practicable after being informed of error in writing by bargaining unit member or Union (was: no error correction provision)

Changed: On or about 15th of month following month in which deductions made, monies deducted by University transmitted by mail or electronically to Union Treasurer or other designee; deductions continue until instruction to cease given in writing by bargaining unit member to University's office of Human Resource Management (was: University transmits on first working day after each payday)

column2: Workspace and Materials Access - General Provision
column5: Initial proposal: University shall provide GSWs free access to University services, materials, and facilities necessary to carry out their duties

column2: Workspace and Materials Access - Desk/Office Space
column5: Initial proposal: Includes individually assigned desk or office space as available that is outside of hazardous lab spaces and within same building as primary work environment or lab if applicable; desk/office space must be lockable and/or within locked space; GSWs have access to individually assigned desk/office space for full work day and after hours as needed

column2: Workspace and Materials Access - Other Resources
column5: Initial proposal: Includes after-hours and weekend building access, library privileges, studio space as available, lockable storage space as available, campus mail, office supplies, meeting spaces as available, office equipment, basic software/hardware, basic lab equipment, grading software, audio/visual presentation equipment, internet access and access to computer, printer or scanner

Initial proposal: GSWs will have access to private locations for grading, office hours, and dealing with confidential materials or other sensitive information; bargaining unit members may utilize Teams or Zoom for office hours if no appropriate meeting location
Initial proposal: University shall not require any GSW to share their individual workspace without their explicit consent

Initial proposal: GSWs who believe they need additional materials/equipment for work may request from their advisor, supervisor, or PI; supervisor-approved additional work materials provided in timely manner following request; GSWs shall not be penalized for lack of access to additional materials not purchased in timely manner; with supervisor approval, if GSW purchases additional work materials not otherwise provided, reimbursed within 14 days of expense report submission; no limit on when reimbursement requests can be submitted

Initial proposal: If University or Union determines protective clothing/equipment/PPE or related tools/materials required by GSW's assignment, University at no cost furnishes and maintains following ECOS or OARS PPE program protocol; GSWs shall not be restricted from or penalized for taking additional safety precautions as they deem necessary; PPE and first aid equipment provided where deemed needed
Initial proposal: In event ECOS and Union disagree on what PPE required for task, arbitration to be expedited
Initial proposal: All GSWs may wear any and all PPE including but not limited to masks and respirators they choose to wear in University spaces

Initial proposal: If lab workspace requires safety glasses or airtight goggles as PPE, GSW with vision prescription may request prescription safety glasses or airtight goggles from supervisor if lab goggles interfere with GSW's vision; provided at no cost to GSW
Initial proposal: GSWs shall have access to internet access, computers with internet access, printers, and scanners at no cost
Initial proposal: GSWs may request specific services, materials, and facilities not provided pursuant to other sections; requests shall not be unreasonably denied

Initial proposal: Ergonomic equipment may be requested by GSWs through OARS or ECOS with copy of request simultaneously provided to supervisor and must be provided to all GSWs upon request; requests shall not be unreasonably denied; ergonomic and safety evaluations and training from OARS or ECOS available to all GSWs

Initial proposal: Ergonomic equipment for computer use includes but not limited to adjustable height sitting/standing desks, ergonomic input devices (keyboards/mice designed for ergonomics), laptop stands, monitors, adjustable monitor arms, ergonomic chairs, pointing devices, screen reader and voice accessibility software
Initial proposal: University will continue to incorporate currently accepted ergonomic practices and guidelines deemed applicable into new and existing workplace and workstation designs

column2: Remote Work - Accommodations and Resource Parity
column5: Initial proposal: University will accommodate all requests for remote and/or online work without requiring medical documentation from GSWs; GSWs may work remotely in following situations: 1) GSW requests, 2) if not possible to grant individually assigned desk/office space until adequate space assigned, 3) if required by University, 4) if recommended by medical professional (see Health & Safety)

Initial proposal: University notifies GSWs if work location to be moved to another building or substantial alteration of workspace with at least 60 days notice before move or alteration for stipended graduate students; GSWs shall not be expected to move or relocate materials/equipment necessary for work if they notify supervisor at time they learn of move that they will not be moving/relocating
Initial proposal: University will make every attempt to schedule evening courses in buildings with other activities

column2: Workspace and Materials Access - Desk/Office Space Availability

column2: Workspace and Materials Access - Lockable Space

Changed: University accommodates all requests for remote/online work without requiring medical documentation; GSWs may work remotely for: 1) GSW requests, 2) if not possible to grant individually assigned desk/office space until adequate space assigned, 3) if required by University, 4) if recommended by medical professional (was: request accommodations through Disability Access Services; supervisor discretion for non-medical remote work; resources same as campus with same health/safety level)
Changed: University notifies GSWs if work location moved to another building or substantial workspace alteration with at least 45 days notice before move or alteration (was: 30 days)

Changed: University shall provide bargaining unit members ('GSWs') free access to services, materials, facilities the University and/or GSW's supervisor determines are necessary to carry out duties (was: University only in 09-19-24; University and/or supervisor in Union 11-18-24)

Changed: Individually assigned desk or office space outside of hazardous lab spaces deemed to be unsafe by University (was: outside of hazardous lab spaces in Union 11-18-24 without 'deemed unsafe by University')
Changed: Desk or office space as available may be lockable and will be secured as with other building areas (was: lockable storage space as available in Union 11-18-24)

column2: Workspace Access - Access to Assigned Space
column5: Changed: Bargaining unit members will have access to any individually assigned desk or office space (was: their individually assigned space in Union 11-18-24)
Changed: Removed Section 2 on prohibition of required sharing without consent (was: restored by Union in 11-18-24)

column2: Additional Work Materials - Request and Provision
column5: Changed: GSWs who believe they need additional materials/equipment may request from supervisor and will not be penalized for lacking materials they requested and supervisor agreed are necessary to carry out work; approved requests either purchased by supervisor or with approval may be purchased by GSW; GSWs making approved purchases submit for reimbursement through applicable process; reimbursements processed in timely manner provided GSWs follow process requirements including submitting receipts (was: request from advisor/supervisor/PI; supervisor-approved materials provided in timely manner; no penalization for lack of access to materials not purchased in timely manner; if GSW purchases, reimbursed within 14 days; no limit on submission)
Changed: If University or Union determines protective clothing/equipment/PPE required by GSW's assignment (was: ECOS or Union in 09-19-24; University or Union in 11-18-24)
No change: Maintained PPE and relevant first aid equipment provided in workplaces where deemed needed
Changed: Removed provision about GSWs not being restricted from or penalized for taking additional safety precautions (was: in Union 11-18-24)

Changed: If lab workspace requires safety glasses or airtight goggles as PPE, GSW with prescription glasses may request prescription safety glasses or airtight goggles if lab goggles do not fit over prescription glasses consistent with applicable safety requirements determined by lab supervisor or OARS (was: GSW with vision prescription; if goggles interfere with vision in Union 11-18-24)

Changed: Ergonomic and safety evaluations and training offered by OARS or ECOS related to GSW's assigned work duties shall be available to applicable bargaining unit members (was: available to all GSWs in Union 11-18-24)

Changed: Bargaining unit members may request work accommodations necessary due to medical condition through applicable Disability Access Services procedures; requests to work remotely unrelated to medical condition may be raised by GSW directly with supervisor; determinations to allow remote work made on case-by-case basis at supervisor's discretion and shall not be precedential; University provides GSWs working remotely with same resources with same level of health and safety as campus work (was: University accommodates all requests without medical documentation; GSWs may work remotely for requests, lack of space, University requirement, or medical recommendation)
Changed: University notifies bargaining unit members if work location moved to another building or substantial workspace alteration with at least 30 days notice (was: 45 days in Union 11-18-24)

column2: Workspace Access - Eligibility for Individually Assigned Space
column5: Changed: University provides GSWs free access to services, materials, facilities University and/or GSW's supervisor (advisor, PI, etc.) determines necessary; includes individually assigned desk or office space as available for all stipended GSWs and hourly GSWs working at least average of 15 hours per week across any held positions; hourly GSWs working average under 15 hours per week have access to dedicated shared desk or office space to complete assigned work; in all cases desk/office space outside hazardous lab spaces and within same building as primary work environment or lab if applicable (was: individually assigned space without hourly worker hour thresholds or dedicated shared space provision)

Changed: All stipended and hourly GSWs working at least average of 15 hours per week have access to lockable storage space which may be shared with other GSWs such as in communal locked office or desk drawer; lockable storage available to hourly GSWs wherever possible (was: lockable storage space as available without hour thresholds or sharing specifications)

Changed: Additional access to services/materials/facilities includes after-hours and weekend building access, library privileges, studio space as available, lockable storage space as available, campus mail, office supplies, meeting spaces as available, office equipment, basic software/hardware, basic lab equipment, grading software, audio/visual presentation equipment, internet access and access to computer/printer/scanner; desk or office space must be lockable and secured as with other building areas; GSWs have access to their individually assigned desk/office space for full work day and after hours (was: desk space may be lockable; access to any individually assigned space)

Changed: Restored Section 2 - University shall not require stipended GSWs and hourly GSWs working at least average of 15 hours per week to share individual workspace without agreement; GSWs may volunteer to share workspace due to lack of available space; should stipended GSW or hourly GSW working at least 15 hours per week volunteer to share workspace, remote work accommodated (was: any GSW without hour thresholds; explicit consent not agreement; no volunteering or remote work accommodation provisions)

column2: Additional Work Materials - Provision Timing and Penalization
column5: Changed: GSWs who believe they need additional materials/equipment may request from advisor, supervisor, or PI; supervisor-approved additional work materials provided in timely manner following request; GSWs shall not be penalized for lack of access to additional materials not purchased in timely manner; with supervisor approval, if GSW purchases additional materials not otherwise provided, reimbursed within 14 days of expense report submission; GSWs can submit reimbursement requests for 90 days following date of purchase (was: request from supervisor only; will not be penalized for lacking materials supervisor agreed necessary; approved requests either purchased by supervisor or with approval purchased by GSW; reimbursements processed in timely manner following process requirements; no 90-day deadline or 14-day reimbursement guarantee)

Changed: GSWs shall not be restricted from or penalized for wearing protective mask or respirator; all GSWs may wear any and all PPE including masks and respirators they choose in University spaces consistent with applicable policies (was: not restricted from or penalized for taking additional safety precautions as they deem necessary; masks/respirators specifically mentioned separately)

Changed: If lab workspace requires goggles as PPE, GSW with vision prescription may request prescription safety goggles if lab goggles interfere with GSW's vision consistent with applicable safety requirements determined by lab supervisor or OARS; provided at no cost (was: prescription glasses not vision prescription; safety glasses or airtight goggles not just goggles; if do not fit over not if interfere with)

Changed: Ergonomic equipment may be requested by GSWs through OARS or ECOS with copy of request simultaneously provided to supervisor and must be provided to all GSWs upon request; requests shall not be unreasonably denied (was: no 'must be provided upon request' or 'not unreasonably denied' in University 12-09-24)

Changed: Ergonomic and safety evaluations and training offered by OARS or ECOS available to all GSWs (was: related to GSW's assigned work duties and available to applicable bargaining unit members in University 12-09-24)

Changed: University will continue to incorporate accepted ergonomic practices and guidelines deemed applicable into new and existing workplace and workstation designs (was: will also make reasonable effort to incorporate in University 12-09-24)

Changed: Added that University shall not make any policy impacting GSWs requiring specific amount of attendance or work in specific location beyond what necessary to complete specific GSW's tasks, contingent on applicable law and accreditation requirements; neither University nor GSW's supervisor shall unreasonably deny requests to work remotely including for short-term and long-term medical and disability accommodations (was: no restriction on University policies; only medical condition accommodations through Disability Access Services; supervisor discretion for non-medical remote work)

Changed: University accommodates all requests for remote/online work without requiring medical documentation; GSWs may work remotely for: 1) GSW requests, 2) if not possible to grant individually assigned desk/office space until adequate space assigned, 3) if required by University, 4) if recommended by medical professional (was: medical condition through Disability Access Services; non-medical at supervisor discretion case-by-case; not precedential)

Changed: University notifies GSWs if work location moved to another building or substantial workspace alteration with at least 30 days notice before move or alteration for stipended graduate students (was: bargaining unit members; no 'for stipended graduate students' specification)
Initial proposal: University shall maintain minimum on-campus housing units for GSWs equal to 10% of total unit of GSWs for duration of this Agreement
Initial proposal: Priority for housing given to: 1) GSWs from more than 1,500 miles away, 2) GSWs with families, or 3) GSWs with disabilities

Initial proposal: Housing and Residential Life (HRL) shall work with Disability Access Services (DAS) and Office of Parent/Family Programs to ensure that GSWs with disabilities or with families obtain housing that meets their accommodation needs

Initial proposal: HRL shall ensure all graduate housing units are cleaned, renovated, and facilities are in good condition prior to assigned move-in dates; additional maintenance and servicing of emergent issues shall be performed in timely manner

Initial proposal: HRL shall ensure all bedrooms in graduate housing units have locks, basic furnishings, standard electrical outlets, and other safety devices (i.e. smoke detectors and carbon monoxide detectors installed correctly as required by law)
Initial proposal: Graduate housing costs (including utilities and average WiFi costs) shall be no greater than 20% of GSW minimum salary level

Initial proposal: Northeastern shall maintain housing resources page for GSWs that shall include, but not be limited to: off-campus rental properties, rental rights and legal services, centralized roommate finder, on-campus housing options
Initial proposal: Effective upon implementation of agreement, GSWs shall have option of opting in to University sponsored transit pass program, parking pass program, and cycling program
Initial proposal: All GSWs may request to be provided with MBTA Monthly LinkPass to be renewed to their transit card monthly for entire term of employment at no cost to them
Initial proposal: By additional request, GSWs provided with MBTA Monthly Commuter Rail Pass CharlieTicket of appropriate zone to be renewed monthly for entire term of employment at no cost
Initial proposal: All benefits pertaining to parking passes must be transferable between members of carpool
Initial proposal: GSWs may request Parking Permit to be provided at no cost to them
Initial proposal: If University policy triggers suspension of parking pass, GSW shall be returned prorated cost of pass

Initial proposal: Parking availability shall be topic raised by Labor Management Committee to address long term parking needs of unit; prior to agreed upon long term solution, at minimum 20% of each lot or garage must be reserved for unit members
Initial proposal: By request, GSWs provided with Blue Bikes Monthly Memberships to be renewed monthly for entire term of employment

Initial proposal: Bicycle commuters eligible for reimbursement of up to $30/month at maximum of $360/year for costs associated with bicycle purchase, improvement, repair and storage; benefit operates on calendar year; total reimbursement amount accrues over calendar year and paid back against total eligible expenses incurred in same year; reimbursement claims processed and paid in beginning of following year; paperwork must be submitted by GSW no later than March 1

Initial proposal: All existing indoor bicycle storage available to GSWs will be maintained; indoor bicycle storage available to GSWs expanded to at least 177 Huntington, West Village H, Fenway Lab, and Curry Student Center within 6 months of ratification
Initial proposal: Best bicycle safety practices and current bicycle registration form will be publicized to all incoming GSWs at orientation

Changed: Bargaining unit members shall have access to and may choose from parking and transit benefit options outlined in this Article (was: GSWs have option of opting in to University sponsored programs)

Changed: Bargaining unit members shall have access to opportunities to park on campus through parking options offered to students through University parking vendor, MassParc (was: GSWs may request Parking Permit at no cost; 20% minimum lot/garage reservation; carpool transferability; prorated refunds for suspended passes)
Changed: Bargaining unit members may take advantage of discounted MBTA passes offered to students at University (was: MBTA Monthly LinkPass and Commuter Rail Pass provided at no cost)

Changed: Bargaining unit members eligible for bicycle benefits and access to any bike facilities on same basis as that offered to other students at University (was: Blue Bikes memberships provided; $360/year bicycle commuter reimbursement; expanded indoor storage at specific buildings; best practices publicized at orientation)
Initial proposal: All GSWs employed shall be provided one-time relocation stipend of $6,000 upon hiring

Initial proposal: All GSWs eligible to participate in University's retirement plan on same terms and conditions as other employees in accordance with terms of retirement plan; GSWs eligible to participate immediately upon beginning first appointment; University shall provide contribution of 10% of eligible compensation each paycheck to GSWs who elect to participate; GSWs may contribute amount of eligible compensation as allowed by law

Initial proposal: All GSWs eligible to participate in supplemental retirement plan in accordance with University's supplemental retirement plan terms; GSWs eligible immediately upon beginning first appointment; plan allows GSWs to contribute pre-tax income toward retirement
Initial proposal: University shall reimburse each GSW up to $600 for documented expenses related to tax assistance from licensed professional or software each tax year
Initial proposal: University shall provide GSWs with all documentation necessary to file their taxes in timely manner
Initial proposal: University shall provide GSWs with option to voluntarily withhold portion of their income for tax purposes
Initial proposal: University shall maintain and provide GSWs with directory of licensed professionals, indicating expertise filing taxes for international students
Initial proposal: Tuition remission will be provided to all GSWs
Initial proposal: Tuition remission maintained through internships, co-ops, or paid and unpaid leaves of any type
Initial proposal: Tuition remission will be sole burden of University; no forms or administrative burden (e.g., emails to GSW regarding tuition payments) may be placed on GSW to fulfill this benefit

Initial proposal: Upon completion of required coursework, all salaried GSWs automatically registered into appropriate courses for degree continuation, including reading classes of appropriate credit quantities, to maintain full-time status necessary for tuition remission; GSWs provide necessary notification in case of internships, co-ops, and other exceptions for registration to be changed

Initial proposal: All GSWs will receive remission for all fees including but not limited to: Health & Counseling Center Fee, Graduate Student Activity Fee, Recreation Fee, Student Center Fee, International Student Fee
Initial proposal: Tuition and fees should be remitted from GSW's account upon appointment; GSWs should not receive billing notifications for remitted tuition and fees
Initial proposal: For duration of agreement, no additional fees can only be imposed on GSWs, except by mutual agreement of Union and University

Initial proposal: Salaried GSWs shall receive total of 21 days of paid vacation time off for 12-month appointment, pro-rated for less than 12-month appointment; vacation counts as being accrued in its entirety at start of GSW's appointment
Initial proposal: Hourly GSWs shall have minimum of 3 days of paid vacation per appointment; for every 20 hours worked, hourly GSW receives additional 3 hours of vacation time
Initial proposal: Vacation requests submitted in advance to GSW's direct supervisor

column2: No Reduction in Benefits or Pay
column5: Initial proposal: No reduction in benefits, if applicable, or pay for taking vacation time; if designated University holiday or work/professional development-related travel (conferences, trainings, etc.) falls during GSW's vacation, GSW not charged vacation time for that holiday or travel; GSW not required to use vacation time for paid medical, parental, or familial leave

Initial proposal: Supervisors shall not expect work or contact GSWs with expectation of work or assigning tasks during GSW's approved vacation; GSWs not expected to respond while on vacation; at approval of GSW, if necessary for them to work during approved vacation, GSW chooses alternate time off which shall not be unreasonably denied
Initial proposal: Unused vacation time carried forward into future appointments; at end of final appointment, GSW paid for unused vacation time

Changed: Stipended graduate students entitled to two (2) days off with pay each semester (fall and spring) and one (1) day off with pay each summer term (summer 1 and summer 2) that they are working; time off must be approved at least two weeks in advance by supervisor and may not require cancelation of class or lab (was: salaried GSWs receive 21 days for 12-month appointment pro-rated)

Changed: Students may request additional time off for particular academic term with supervisor, but any additional days at discretion of supervisor and college; no arrangements concerning time off with additional time off for any student differs from what outlined in provision including granting of additional time off shall create any right for similar arrangement or additional time off for any other student (was: no supervisor/college discretion language or non-precedent setting clause)

Changed: Parties agree stipended graduate students able to use all paid time off provided during term, and therefore any time off not used during given academic term will not carry over into succeeding term (was: unused vacation time carried forward into future appointments and paid out at end of final appointment)
Changed: Students may not use both days together within first month of appointment, except as allowed by graduate student's supervisor (was: no restriction on timing of vacation use)

Changed: Stipended graduate students may request up to three (3) paid personal days per academic year; days accrued at rate of one day per semester worked (fall, spring, summer); unused days may be carried over into next academic term if graduate student is performing bargaining unit work, but may not be carried forward into following year; requests for paid personal days subject to approval and may not require cancelation of class or lab; requests must be submitted with graduate student's supervisor, with copy to relevant associate dean for graduate affairs at least two weeks in advance (was: no separate personal time provision in Union's vacation proposal)
Changed: Removed all vacation provisions for hourly GSWs (was: hourly GSWs have minimum 3 days paid vacation per appointment; for every 20 hours worked receive additional 3 hours vacation time)
Changed: Removed simple advance submission to direct supervisor (was: vacation requests submitted in advance to GSW's direct supervisor)

column2: No Reduction in Benefits or Pay
column5: Changed: Removed provisions about no reduction in benefits/pay for taking vacation; removed provision about not charging vacation time if University holiday or work/professional development travel falls during vacation; removed provision about not requiring vacation use for paid medical, parental, or familial leave (was: comprehensive protections)

Changed: Removed provisions prohibiting supervisors from expecting work or contacting GSWs during approved vacation; removed provision about GSWs not expected to respond while on vacation; removed provision about choosing alternate time off if necessary to work during vacation (was: strong vacation protection from work expectations)
Initial proposal: There shall be no audio or video recording of any negotiations
Initial proposal: Student Bargaining Committee members will not participate in negotiations during their work hours
Initial proposal: Length of bargaining sessions limited to 2 hours, unless extended by mutual agreement of parties
Initial proposal: Once negotiations begun, scheduled sessions take place at least once every 2 weeks until complete and final agreement reached on all items; dates selected by mutual agreement
Initial proposal: Whenever possible, proposals from any party should be submitted in writing and provided to parties in electronic format

Initial proposal: University shall identify location for bargaining as soon as possible in advance of scheduled meetings and will provide private location for Union to caucus; Union may request alternate location, if necessary, and such requests shall not be unreasonably denied by University

Initial proposal: Each party shall designate one (1) person to act as primary contact for communications and logistical issues related to negotiations; all other communications related to negotiations sent to Union's email address (nugradworkers@gmail.com) and University's preferred email address
Initial proposal: Neither party shall be obligated to produce copies of bargaining notes or minutes to other party
Initial proposal: There shall be no agreement on any one item unless there is final agreement on all items
Initial proposal: Any counter-proposals shall be redlined so it is clear what changes are being proposed

Initial proposal: Bargaining is open and accessible to observers from both parties, with options for both in-person and virtual attendance available to Bargaining Committee and observers of each party
Initial proposal: Union reserves right to modify, subtract, delete or add to any of these proposals at any time
No change: Maintained there shall be no audio or video recording of any negotiations
Changed: Student Bargaining Committee members represent that they will not participate in negotiations during their work hours (was: Student Bargaining Committee members will not participate)
No change: Maintained length of bargaining sessions limited to 2 hours, unless extended by mutual agreement

Changed: University shall identify location for bargaining as soon as possible in advance of scheduled meetings and will provide private location for Union to caucus; Union may request alternate location (was: such requests shall not be unreasonably denied by University)

Changed: Each party designates one person as primary contact for communications and logistical issues related to negotiations when parties are not meeting; all other communications related to negotiations sent to Union's email (nugradworkers@gmail.com) and University's contact point at s.merrill@northeastern.edu with copy to k.montgomery@northeastern.edu (was: University's preferred email address without specific addresses)
No change: Maintained neither party obligated to produce copies of bargaining notes or minutes to other party
No change: Maintained there shall be no agreement on any one item unless final agreement on all items

Changed: Any counter-proposals shall be redlined so clear what changes are being proposed; whenever possible, proposals should be submitted in writing and provided in electronic format (was: separate provisions with written proposals first)

Changed: Bargaining limited to bargaining team/committee of each party and observers shall not be allowed except by mutual agreement (was: bargaining open and accessible to observers from both parties with in-person and virtual options)
Changed: Removed provision about scheduled sessions taking place at least once every 2 weeks until complete agreement (was: explicit 2-week frequency requirement)
Changed: Removed Union's reservation of right to modify, subtract, delete or add to proposals at any time (was: explicit Union right to modify)
